title: PEGASIS
content:
PEGASIS was a Naiad-nymph of a spring of the River Grenikos (Granicus) in the Troad (north-western Anatolia).
        She was the mother of Atymnios (Atymnius), a minor ally of the Trojans in their war with the Greeks.

Quintus Smyrnaeus, Fall of Troy 3. 300 ff (trans. Way) (Greek epic C4th A.D.)
          :
        "Atymnios [an ally of Troy], the goodly son whom Pegasis the bright-haired Nymphe had borne to strong
        Emathion by Granikos' (Granicus') stream."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
